entry.title: Armenia silent as Russia says working to restore Mir payment card services: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia silent as Russia says working to restore Mir payment card services: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs Central Bank this week cut interest rates by 25 basis points to 8%, as inflation continues to remain well below target levels. üìç The Central Bank neither confirmed nor denied that Russia is working to restore access to Mir, its national payment system, in Armenia. In March, almost all of Armenia‚Äôs banks moved to block Mir transactions, citing U.S. sanctions. üìç Armenia‚Äôs antimonopoly watchdog greenlit the sale of HSBC Armenia to Ardshinbank, moving the deal one step closer to completion. The Central Bank must still sign off.

entry.title: Belarus armed Azerbaijan for war against Armenia, POLITICO reports

media:group.media:title: Belarus armed Azerbaijan for war against Armenia, POLITICO reports
media:group.media:description:
üìç POLITICO Europe reported yesterday that leaked documents confirm Belarus delivered advanced weapons to Azerbaijan between 2018 and 2022 which were then used against Armenia. üìç Armenia denied three separate claims in the last three days that it fired at Azerbaijani positions. Lawyers for Ruben Vardanyan sent an urgent appeal to the United Nations over his alleged torture in Azerbaijani captivity. üìç Local and international journalist groups condemn police violence at Wednesday‚Äôs protest outside parliament which saw at least 12 reporters injured.

entry.title: How Armenia is joining the space race

media:group.media:title: How Armenia is joining the space race
media:group.media:description:
In this interview, Babken Der Grigoryan, founder and CEO of Kartes Analytica discusses Armenia's ambitious plans to develop an advanced national space program, examining its recent landmark participation in the Artemis Accords. He analyzes the strategic and economic importance of the burgeoning Armenian space sector, as well as its implications for national security.

entry.title: Pashinyan orders Armenian officials to refrain from visiting Belarus, as relations nosedive

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan orders Armenian officials to refrain from visiting Belarus, as relations nosedive
media:group.media:description:
üìç Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan once again indicated he plans to take Armenia out of the Collective Security Treaty Organization, a Russian-led military alliance, though he stopped short of formally announcing a withdrawal or providing any timeline. üìç Pashinyan ordered all Armenian officials not to visit Belarus, a close Russian ally. üìç The United States reiterated its support for an Armenia-Azerbaijan normalization deal.

entry.title: Digital transformation: How IT talent can thrive with Ameriabank

media:group.media:title: Digital transformation: How IT talent can thrive with Ameriabank
media:group.media:description:
Davit Hovhannisyan, chief information officer at Ameriabank, sits down with CivilNet‚Äôs Mark Dovich to talk about his decision to repatriate to Armenia and continue his career at one of Armenia‚Äôs leading financial institutions after nearly 30 years overseas. They also discuss Ameriabank‚Äôs digital transformation and the need to improve human resource processes in Armenia‚Äôs burgeoning IT sector.
